noun.description: A large and mainly tropical grasshopper with strong powers of flight. It is usually solitary, but from time to time there is a population explosion, and it migrates in vast swarms that cause extensive damage to crops.
The large edible pod of some plants of the pea family, in particular the carob bean, which is said to resemble a locust.
Any of a number of pod-bearing trees of the pea family, in particular the carob tree and the black locust.

origin: Middle English: via Old French locuste from Latin locusta locust, crustacean.
